basics.name: Matthew Fine
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary: A Site Reliability Engineer with professional Network and Systems Engineering experience in corporate, public service, and large distributed networks with a strong emphasis on scalability, supportability, and longevity.

work.position: Site Reliablitly Engineer / Senior Software Developer
highlights: SRE role within the supply chain group at The Home Depot.
Helping teams gain a better insight into their systems and applications.
Building containers with Docker.
Orchestrating containers using Docker Swarm or Kubernetes.
Scraping metrics using Prometheus and graphing those metrics with Grafana, and alerting on those metrics using AlertManager
Lifting and shipping containers to Cloud (Google Cloud Platform) or On-premise.
Using a 12-Factor app mindset to build applications.
Wrangling cattle while still lovingly caring for some pets still left behind (free-range cattle).
Automating all the repetitive tasks and automating for quicker, safer, and faster deployments.
Using pipelines to deploy.
Creating actionable alerts.
Collaborating in Git to check-in code and documentation
Mentoring team members.
Setup Juniper Zero Touch Provisioning on switches for fully automated deployments.
Automated desktops OS and software installation and configuration using PXE boot and Kickstart to deploy no-touch provisioned systems.
Deployed site-wide Ruckus virtualized Zone Director and Ruckus APs.
Identified issues in the network related to L2 and L3 designs, implemented and documented changes.
Installed and configured BIRD for FreeBSD systems to use as eBGP routers connecting to upstream internet providers.
Configured GitLab for our developers and used GitLab for revision control with gitfs for SaltStack.
Wrote SaltStack formulas to automate and help maintain consistency throughout the network.
Setup IPsec site-to-site connectivity for satellite locations and remote employees.
Leveraged Bacula backup system to develop a backup solution for our servers and databases.
Procured /32 IPv6 space from ARIN, allocated and implemented in our environment.
Documented all work using RST and published it on the internal site.

Identified a BGP architecture that could optimize bandwidth distribution across multiple carriers. Took the initiative to plan and implement new architecture, resulting in savings to the company and better traffic control.
Developed and executed plans to consolidate equipment in six data centers into two without downtime.
Deployed networking gear at sites around the world connecting to multi-homed providers.
Setup DWDM to connect fiber between our data centers.
Discovered and remedied inefficient OSPF configuration, leading to cleaner and better functioning network.
Implemented Ansible to make configuration changes across multiple sites and devices.
Attended NANOG to gain a better understanding of industry practices.
Configured safeguards to mitigate against amplification attacks and DDOS.
Replaced proprietary script only backing up certain vendor configuration with open source tool, Rancid, to backup configurations from multiple vendors.
Deployed Netflow to gain a better insight into network traffic patterns.
Created documentation and network diagrams.
Designed high availability networks with redundancy and scalability in mind.
Evaluated and selected new hardware.
Configured and maintained; Juniper MX routers, Juniper QFX/EX switches, Juniper SRX firewalls, A10 load balancers, Cisco routers/firewalls/switches, and various other products.

work.position: Previous network and systems experience begins with UUNet in 1998 and includes; AT&T Wifi Services, Pace, and Mobile 365 / Sybase.
highlights: Deployed wireless and wired solutions to McDonald's and Starbucks.
Installed wireless solutions at AT&T Park, AT&T Stadium, and other large permanent venues.
More information upon request.
